results.content: This course was very well done and I got so much out of this that I hadn't really understood before. I highly recommend this course and am going to look at getting more by Ben Fhala.

results.content: instructor is knowledgeable and engaging.  his teaching style to summarize a lecture and the recap it is very well-done.  thanks, Ben.

results.content:
The github repo and source files are not listed for this course and the instructor does not tell you where to find them. Luckily someone else posted in the "Q&A" section where to find the files: https://www.packtpub.com/web-development/learning-react-reusable-components-video. Section 5 part 4 still does not have sound.

Section 1 is the hardest to get through to make sure that your files match the tutorial but once you get past that, it is much easier to follow along and learn something!

results.content:
This course is a practical guide on how to extract a basic bootstrap application into react components.  It spends some time at the end making the page dynamically render components based on hard coded json structures (not react-router).  

I enjoyed the pace a which the course progressed.  The author spends very little time discussing peripheral technologies which is nice because it keeps the course on topic and less conflated than other courses.

It should be noted that the publisher does not provide the _required_ course files along with the course.  I had to use come google-fu to find that the course content that was hidden behind an authwall at Packt site.  

It should also be noted that the audio for section 5 lecture 24 is missing at the time of this review.

If i were to name this course I would call it a "Practical guide to Convert a simple Bootstrap HTML site into React components"

I would say that if you already know how to create a basic React application and components that you will not get much takeaway from this course.

This course is a practical guide on how to extract a basic bootstrap application into react components. It spends some time at the end making the page dynamically render components based on hard coded json structures (not react-router).

I enjoyed the pace a which the course progressed. The author spends very little time discussing peripheral technologies which is nice because it keeps the course on topic and less conflated than other courses.

It should be noted that the publisher does not provide the _required_ course files along with the course. I had to use come google-fu to find that the course content that was hidden behind an authwall at Packt site.

It should also be noted that the audio for section 5 lecture 24 is missing at the time of this review.

If i were to name this course I would call it a "Practical guide to Convert a simple Bootstrap HTML site into React components"

I would say that if you already know how to create a basic React application and components that you will not get much takeaway from this course.
